WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
This is perhaps a little bit ironic.  I couldn't figure out where to post this except here.   I got the following in IE8.

 

Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.0; Trident/4.0; SLCC1; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; InfoPath.2; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E; MS-RTC LM 8)
Timestamp: Mon, 8 Oct 2012 18:03:05 UTC


Message: Object doesn't support this action
Line: 59
Char: 9
Code: 0
URI: http://www.typescriptlang.org/script/Panorama.js


Message: Object doesn't support this action
Line: 16
Char: 9
Code: 0
URI: http://www.typescriptlang.org/script/Clouds.js


Message: 'TSSite.PanoramaContainer' is null or not an object
Line: 179
Char: 13
Code: 0
URI: http://www.typescriptlang.org/

Comments.Message: I know exactly what the first two errors are, they are thanks to TypeScript's implementation of Object.defineProperty, which as we all know is not supported in IE 7 and below, and is supported very differently in IE 8 than all other browsers (IE 9 included). This issue is something that can't be fixed with a simple shiv or anything similar. It's going to require that the way TypeScript does get and set accessors be changed.
